job_description:
Business Analyst

The Business Analyst plays a key role in ensuring requirements are clearly understood, accurately documented, and traceable throughout the software development lifecycle. This role focuses on translating business and functional inputs into structured, standardized documentation that supports effective development, testing, and delivery. Working closely with business analysts, design teams, and technical stakeholders, the role ensures consistency, clarity, and alignment across all requirement artifacts.

Key Responsibilities

  • Create Software Requirement Specifications (SRS) based on inputs from Core Business Analysts, stakeholder discussions, and requirement walkthroughs
  • Prepare Business Requirement Documents (BRD) using approved templates while ensuring business intent and system behavior are clearly documented
  • Participate in requirement discussions to understand business objectives, functional flows, dependencies, and assumptions before documentation
  • Analyze requirements to identify gaps, ambiguities, and inconsistencies, and work with Core BAs to resolve them
  • Document functional flows, business rules, and acceptance criteria where applicable to support development and QA teams
  • Document wireframes, UI flows, validations, and UI specifications in collaboration with design and product teams
  • Maintain change logs, version history, and document updates throughout the project lifecycle
  • Create and manage traceability matrices linking business, functional, and technical requirements
  • Maintain cross-references across BRD, SRS, UI, API, and related documentation
  • Ensure documentation consistency, completeness, and alignment with approved scope and delivery timelines
  • Ensure accurate and timely PMS updates with structured documentation details
  • Support development, QA, UAT, and audit processes through clear, traceable, and up-to-date documentation
  • Assist in requirement reviews, walkthroughs, and validation sessions with internal and client stakeholders

Requirements

Required Skills and Experience - 1 to 4 years of experience in Business Analysis documentation or related roles - Strong experience in BRD and SRS creation - Hands-on experience with documentation templates, standards, and version control - Ability to document UI wireframes and functional flows clearly - Working knowledge of APIs and system integrations for documentation purposes - Experience with project management systems and documentation tools - Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple documents in parallel - Excellent written communication and stakeholder coordination skills

Minimum Qualifications - Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field - 1 to 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Translates business needs into structured documentation for software development. Ensures clarity, traceability, and alignment across teams.

job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly.
  • Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement.
  • Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding.
  • Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies.
  • Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations.
  • Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute.
  • Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviours, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies.
  • Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria.
  • Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding.
  • Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria.
  • Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately.
  • Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly.
  • Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development.
  • Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability.
  • Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Requirements

Required Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking.
  • Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications.
  • Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity.
  • Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity.
  • Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams.
  • Understanding of API behaviours, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions.
  • Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions.
  • Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage.
  • Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs.
  • Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers.
  • Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
  • 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst
  • Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments
  • Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems
  • Ability to run independent client workshops
  • Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior Business Analyst role requiring 4+ years of experience to translate complex business needs into structured requirements, with expertise in SaaS and API integrations. Responsibilities include leading workshops, ensuring testable documentation, and collaborating across teams for seamless development execution.

job_description:
GS-IT, a leading IT company in Dubai, is committed to excellence, offering professional IT support for infrastructure, IT maintenance, AV, cloud services, cyber security, and strategic IT consulting to drive business success.

JOB DESCRIPTION - SEO Specialist

Responsibilities

  1. Search Engine Optimization (SEO)
  2. Plan and execute end-to-end SEO strategies aligned with business goals focused on IT industry.
  3. Perform in-depth keyword research, competitive analysis, and search intent analysis.
  4. Implement advanced on-page optimization: semantic keywords, internal linking, content clustering, CTR optimization.
  5. Manage and enhance off-page SEO: high-quality link building, digital PR outreach, backlink audits.
  6. Conduct regular technical SEO audits and collaborate with developers to resolve issues related to:
    • Crawlability & indexing
    • Site architecture
    • Page speed & Core Web Vitals
    • Schema markup & structured data
  7. Oversee local SEO efforts including Google Business Profile and local citations.
  8. Track and optimize rankings, organic traffic, and conversions using Google Analytics, Search Console, or similar tools.
  9. Identify new growth opportunities through algorithm trends, SERP behavior, and industry insights.

  10. Plan and execute emerging AI trends and integrate AI-driven insights into SEO strategies and adapt to algorithm changes.

  11. Content Strategy & Optimization

  12. Support and guide the content team with SEO-driven content briefs, keyword mapping, and topical authority planning.
  13. Optimize content for user intent, featured snippets, voice search, and rich results.
  14. Review and update existing content to improve ranking potential and user engagement.

  15. Ensure all content meets SEO best practices, readability standards, and brand guidelines.

  16. Performance Monitoring & Reporting

  17. Set up SEO dashboards and reporting frameworks for ongoing performance analysis.
  18. Prepare monthly SEO reports with insights, outcomes, and strategic recommendations.
  19. Analyze conversion paths, landing page performance, and behavioral metrics to improve UX and retention.

  20. Provide actionable suggestions to improve website visibility, structure, and search performance.

  21. Collaboration & Digital Marketing Support

  22. Coordinate with design, content, and development teams to ensure SEO integration across all digital assets.
  23. Support broader digital marketing activities, including campaign optimization and landing page improvements.
  24. Ensure alignment of SEO roadmap with overall digital marketing goals.
  25. Support digital marketing team in enquiry management via chats, calls, or email.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, IT, Computer Science, Business, or related fields.
  • 2–3 years proven experience in SEO with measurable results.
  • Solid understanding of search engine algorithms, ranking factors, and on-page/off-page strategies.
  • Good knowledge of HTML, CSS basics, CMS platforms, and website architecture.
  • Experience using Google Search Console, Google Analytics, SEMrush, Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, etc.
  • Familiarity with Core Web Vitals, schema markup, and other technical SEO enhancements.
  • Understanding of AI trends and AI-driven insights in SEO.
  • Strong analytical skills with ability to interpret data and convert insights into strategy.
  • Excellent communication, documentation, and project management skills.

How to Apply

Please send your updated CV to talenthunt@globalsurf.ae with the subject line: “Application for SEO Specialist – GS IT”.
summary: GS-IT in Dubai seeks an SEO Specialist to develop and execute SEO strategies, optimize content, and collaborate with teams to enhance website visibility and drive business success through digital marketing initiatives.

job_description:
Finance & Business Operations Specialist

Why This Role Is Exciting

This role is ideal for someone who wants visibility across the entire business, not just one department. You’ll work closely with the CEO, interact with teams across Australia and India, and gain hands-on exposure to finance, operations, planning, and growth strategy. The role offers meaningful responsibility, variety, and the opportunity to grow into a senior leadership position over time.

Role Overview

The Finance & Business Operations Specialist plays a key role in ensuring the business is financially disciplined, operationally aligned, and prepared for growth across Australia and India. In addition to managing finance and reporting, this role supports business operations across all departments, helps resolve cross-team challenges, and contributes to long-term planning and expansion initiatives. This position is well-suited for someone who enjoys managing multiple priorities across functions, rather than working in a single specialised role.

What You’ll Work On

Financial Management & Reporting - Manage Australian accounting operations using Xero - Prepare monthly MIS, financial reports, and dashboards for leadership - Analyze P&L, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow and present insights - Support compliance activities including GST and BAS coordination

Budgeting, Forecasting & Planning - Prepare and manage annual budgets - Build revenue forecasts, cost projections, and cash flow models - Support department-wise and project-wise budgeting - Track budget vs actuals and recommend improvements

Business Operations & Cross-Team Alignment - Support alignment across finance, delivery, marketing, technology, and operations - Coordinate with teams in Australia and India to ensure smooth execution - Identify risks, bottlenecks, or misalignment and flag them early - Act as a key coordination bridge between teams and the CEO

Growth & Expansion Exposure - Support business expansion and scaling initiatives - Assist with financial modeling for new services, markets, or teams - Evaluate scalability, cost impact, and revenue potential - Gain exposure to strategic planning and leadership decision-making

Who Will Thrive in This Role

  • Someone who enjoys variety, ownership, and responsibility
  • Comfortable managing multiple priorities across teams and functions
  • Curious about how businesses operate end-to-end
  • Strong communicator with cross-cultural collaboration experience
  • Able to balance hands-on execution with strategic thinking

Skills & Experience

  • Strong experience in accounting, budgeting, and financial analysis
  • 2–5 years of relevant work experience in finance, accounting, or business operations
  • Hands-on experience with Xero accounting software
  • Exposure to service-based or project-based business environments
  • Experience in forecasting, cost control, and financial reporting
  • Ability to work across teams and manage multiple priorities effectively

Education & Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business, Management, Commerce, or a related discipline
  • Postgraduate or professional qualifications (preferred): MBA in Finance, Business Analytics, or a related discipline, OR Part-qualified or completed CMA / CFA / ACCA

Work Style & Flexibility

  • Flexible, adaptable, and ownership-driven
  • Comfortable supporting both finance and business operations
  • Able to shift priorities based on business needs

Work Hours & Location

  • Shift Timing: 6:00 AM – 3:00 PM (IST)
  • Work Mode: Mostly Remote and occasionally Hybrid
  • Location Preference: Kochi or Remote

Career Growth

This role offers strong exposure and learning across finance, operations, and strategy, with a clear path to grow into a Finance Lead, Operations Manager, or Business Controller role.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at hr@planetmedia.in.

About Lean Transition Solutions (LTS)

The Lead Developer (PHP) will lead the design, development, and maintenance of PHP-based applications. This role involves hands-on development, technical decision-making, and mentoring team members while delivering scalable, high-quality solutions for international manufacturing clients based on Industry 4.0 and Lean concepts.

Key Responsibilities

1. Technical Leadership & Architecture

  • Lead end-to-end application architecture using PHP and modern frameworks
  • Design scalable, maintainable solutions translating complex manufacturing requirements into robust technical implementations
  • Drive technical decision-making across the development lifecycle
  • Establish and enforce coding standards, best practices, and design patterns
  • Champion code quality through comprehensive reviews and architectural guidance

2. Advanced PHP Development

  • Architect and build sophisticated web applications leveraging PHP's full capabilities
  • Develop clean, efficient, and thoroughly tested code following SOLID principles
  • Design and optimize complex database schemas and queries for high-performance data operations
  • Integrate multiple backend services, APIs, and data sources seamlessly
  • Refactor and modernize legacy codebases for improved performance and maintainability

3. Team Development & Mentorship

  • Mentor and upskill junior and mid-level developers in PHP best practices
  • Conduct thorough code reviews with constructive, educational feedback
  • Foster a culture of continuous learning and technical excellence
  • Share knowledge through documentation, presentations, and pair programming
  • Support career growth and technical development of team members

4. Problem Solving & Optimization

  • Diagnose and resolve complex performance bottlenecks and architectural challenges
  • Implement proactive monitoring and debugging strategies
  • Optimize application performance, database queries, and system resources
  • Apply critical thinking to balance technical debt against feature delivery
  • Identify opportunities for automation and process improvement

5. Collaborative Delivery & DevOps

  • Partner closely with Product, QA, UI/UX, and DevOps teams
  • Participate actively in Agile/Scrum ceremonies and sprint planning
  • Ensure solutions align with customer needs and business objectives
  • Support CI/CD pipeline development and deployment automation

6. Innovation & Continuous Improvement

  • Stay current with PHP ecosystem evolution and emerging web technologies
  • Evaluate and recommend new frameworks, tools, and approaches
  • Drive adoption of modern development practices and tooling
  • Contribute to technical strategy and platform roadmap decisions

Preferred Skills & Required Experience

  • Minimum 5+ years of professional PHP development experience
  • 3+ years in a technical lead or senior developer capacity
  • Proven track record delivering complex, production-grade web applications

Technical Skills

  • Expert-level proficiency in PHP (7.4+/8.x) and Object-Oriented Programming
  • Deep hands-on experience with modern PHP frameworks:
  • Symfony (highly preferred)
  • Laravel, CodeIgniter, or similar MVC frameworks
  • Advanced knowledge of relational databases (MySQL/MariaDB/PostgreSQL)
  • Complex query optimization and performance tuning
  • Database design and normalization
  • Transaction management and data integrity
  • Strong command of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript
  • Experience with RESTful API design and development
  • Proficiency with Git and collaborative development workflows
  • Understanding of design patterns and architectural principles

Additional Technical Skills

  • Frontend framework experience (React) - highly valued
  • Experience with Composer and PHP package management
  • Knowledge of unit testing frameworks (PHPUnit)
  • Familiarity with Docker and containerization
  • Cloud platform experience (AWS)
  • Understanding of DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines
  • Experience with queue systems (RabbitMQ, Redis) - advantageous
  • Knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodologies

Why You’ll Love Working With Us

  • Meaningful Work with Global Impact: Contribute to enterprise platforms used by world-class organizations such as Philips, Hitachi, Pfizer, and other global leaders—helping them improve how they operate, lead, and grow.
  • People-First, Collaborative Culture: Your ideas are heard, your work is valued, and you’re supported by a team built on trust and respect.
  • Purpose-Driven Technology: Build practical, thoughtful products that solve real operational and leadership challenges.
  • Growth & Ownership: Learn continuously, take ownership of your work, and grow your career in a supportive environment.
  • Global Exposure, Human Connection: Work with diverse teams and enterprise clients worldwide—while feeling connected and supported.
  • Quality, Security & Trust: Our platforms and processes are backed by internationally recognized ISO certifications, reflecting our strong commitment to quality, data security, and operational reliability.

Build a Strong Future Together

At LTS, we don’t just deliver solutions—we build long-term relationships. Together, we create a strong, sustainable future for our people, clients, and organization. From continuous learning and career development opportunities to meaningful ownership in your work, we support you at every stage of your journey. Our people benefit from a supportive work environment, competitive benefits, and a culture that values balance, trust, and long-term success.

We are seeking a Finance Manager – FP&A to drive business planning, performance management, and financial decision-making across the organization. This role extends beyond traditional reporting, positioning you as a strategic business partner to leadership—supporting growth, efficiency, and profitability through actionable, data-driven insights. You will lead a high-performing FP&A team and collaborate closely with stakeholders across Business, Product, Marketing, and Operations to convert strategic goals into measurable financial results.

Key Responsibilities

  1. Financial Planning & Business Performance
  2. Lead annual budgeting, quarterly forecasting, and long-term financial planning initiatives.
  3. Own monthly management reporting, variance analysis, and financial dashboards.
  4. Analyze revenue, costs, margins, and key business drivers.

  5. Identify trends, risks, and opportunities, translating insights into actionable recommendations.

  6. Business Partnering

  7. Serve as the finance partner to senior leaders across multiple functions.
  8. Support pricing, investment, hiring, and growth initiatives through financial modeling and scenario analysis.
  9. Partner with Sales, Marketing, Product, and Operations to enhance ROI and unit economics.

  10. Challenge assumptions and promote accountability for financial outcomes.

  11. Strategic Analysis & Decision Support

  12. Develop and maintain financial models for new initiatives, product launches, and market expansions.
  13. Conduct in-depth analyses on profitability, customer cohorts, and cost efficiency.

  14. Deliver clear, data-backed recommendations to leadership.

  15. Team Leadership & Capability Building

  16. Lead, mentor, and develop a team of 4–5 FP&A analysts.
  17. Uphold high standards for accuracy, timeliness, and business relevance.

  18. Establish robust planning, review, and performance-tracking processes.

  19. Systems, Reporting & Process Excellence

  20. Enhance forecasting accuracy and automate reporting processes.
  21. Build scalable dashboards and management MIS.
  22. Ensure data consistency across finance systems and business tools.

Preferred Skills

Must-Have Qualifications

  • 8–10 years of experience in FP&A, Business Finance, or Corporate Finance.
  • Demonstrated experience partnering with business leaders and influencing strategic decisions.
  • Strong people management background, with experience leading teams of 4–5 members.

Senior Data Analyst

DeviceDriven India (P) Ltd Location: Padmanabha, Technopark Campus, Trivandrum, 695581 Website: http://www.devicedriven.com Closing Date: 23, Feb 2026 Published: 23, Jan 2026 Contact Email: jobs@devicedriven.com

Brief Description

We are seeking a Senior Data Analyst who can own end-to-end data pipelines, ensure reporting accuracy at scale, and act as a trusted data partner to product, engineering, and business teams. The platform processes high-volume transactional, behavioral, and partner data that powers business intelligence, operational reporting, reconciliation, and analytics for internal teams and external stakeholders. This role goes beyond dashboarding—you will design ETL workflows, influence data models, troubleshoot production issues, and mentor junior analysts in a complex, enterprise environment.

Role Overview

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will: - Own and evolve enterprise-grade ETL pipelines and BI solutions - Ensure data quality, consistency, and performance across platforms - Design and deliver trusted reporting and analytics used for operational and business decisions - Partner with engineering, DBAs, and cloud teams on data architecture and optimization - Act as a senior point of escalation for data issues and reporting correctness - Guide best practices and mentor junior team members

You will work across SQL Server–based systems and GCP-based cloud workflows, supporting both real-time and batch data use cases.

Key Responsibilities

1. ETL Architecture & Data Engineering

  • Architect, design, and maintain complex SSIS ETL pipelines across multiple data sources
  • Own data ingestion, transformation, and validation logic for large-scale datasets
  • Optimize ETL performance for volume, reliability, and recoverability
  • Implement robust data quality checks, reconciliation logic, and audit controls
  • Lead troubleshooting and root-cause analysis for production data issues
  • Support data migrations, platform integrations, and schema evolution

2. Business Intelligence & Analytics

  • Design and maintain enterprise-grade SSRS reports used by business and operations teams
  • Build and govern Power BI datasets and dashboards with consistent metrics and definitions
  • Design and maintain SSAS cubes for multi-dimensional and historical analysis
  • Ensure KPI definitions, aggregations, and calculations are accurate and aligned
  • Partner with stakeholders to translate business questions into analytics solutions

3. Cloud, Automation & Integrations

  • Design and implement Python-based automation for data processing and monitoring
  • Work with GCP services including BigQuery, Cloud Functions, Cloud Scheduler, and Secret Manager
  • Automate data pipelines, report refreshes, and operational checks
  • Integrate third-party systems via APIs (e.g., JIRA, Zendesk, Matomo)
  • Support hybrid architectures spanning on-prem and cloud environments

4. Leadership, Support & Collaboration

  • Act as a senior escalation point for data and reporting issues
  • Collaborate with DBAs on query optimization, indexing, and performance tuning
  • Participate in production support and on-call rotations as required
  • Define and maintain documentation, standards, and best practices
  • Mentor junior analysts and review their ETL and reporting work
  • Contribute to data governance, naming standards, and metric definitions

Required Skills & Qualifications

Core Technical Skills

  • SQL Server / T-SQL: Expert-level querying, optimization, stored procedures, indexing
  • SSIS: 5+ years designing and owning complex, production ETL pipelines
  • SSRS: Strong experience building operational and executive-level reports
  • Power BI: Advanced dashboarding, data modeling, and DAX usage
  • Python: Data processing, automation, and scripting for analytics workflows

Experience

  • 8–12+ years in Data Analytics, BI Development, or Data Engineering roles
  • Proven experience owning enterprise data platforms end-to-end
  • Experience working with high-volume transactional systems
  • Strong production support and incident troubleshooting experience
  • Experience working in Agile/Scrum environments

Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or related field
  • Or equivalent hands-on professional experience

Preferred Qualifications

  • SSAS cube design and MDX query experience
  • Experience with GCP (BigQuery, Cloud Functions, Cloud Scheduler)
  • Experience with Git / GitHub version control
  • Background in fintech, loyalty, rewards, or high-transaction platforms
  • Microsoft certifications in SQL Server, Power BI, or related data technologies
summary: Senior Data Analyst role requiring 8–12+ years of experience in ETL pipelines, BI solutions, and mentoring. Expertise in SQL Server, SSIS, and Power BI for enterprise data platforms.

About the Opportunity

We are seeking a Senior System Administrator to join our Infrastructure / Site Reliability Engineering team. This role is critical to ensuring the stability, security, and operational excellence of enterprise infrastructure spanning cloud platforms, Windows and Linux systems, identity services, networking, and security tooling. The ideal candidate is a hands-on senior individual contributor with deep operational experience, capable of independently owning infrastructure domains, leading complex maintenance activities, and acting as an escalation point during production incidents.

Role Overview

As a Senior System Administrator, you will: - Own day-to-day reliability and lifecycle management of enterprise infrastructure - Lead patching, maintenance, and security remediation initiatives - Act as a senior escalation point for incidents and operational issues - Ensure compliance with security, audit, and change management processes - Partner closely with SRE, DevOps, Security, Database, and Application teams - Drive operational discipline, documentation, and best practices - Operate across cloud and hybrid environments, balancing stability with continuous improvement

Key Responsibilities

  1. Infrastructure Maintenance & Lifecycle Management
  2. Plan and execute regular infrastructure maintenance and patching cycles
  3. Coordinate system updates, service restarts, and reboots with minimal impact
  4. Perform pre- and post-maintenance validation and reporting
  5. Support infrastructure upgrades, migrations, and decommissioning

  6. Participate in capacity planning and resource optimization

  7. Security, Patching & Vulnerability Remediation

  8. Own remediation of infrastructure vulnerabilities identified by scanning tools
  9. Prioritize and resolve Critical, High, and Medium severity findings within SLAs
  10. Apply security patches to operating systems and core infrastructure components
  11. Partner with security teams on compliance, audits, and remediation tracking

  12. Implement hardening best practices across servers and services

  13. Cloud & Core Infrastructure Administration

  14. Administer cloud-based compute, networking, storage, and IAM services
  15. Manage firewall rules, routing, and secure connectivity
  16. Configure and troubleshoot storage and file system integrations
  17. Build, configure, and maintain virtual machines and system services

  18. Support hybrid environments spanning on-premise and cloud systems

  19. Identity, Access & Certificate Management

  20. Manage enterprise identity and access systems (directory services, SSO, MFA)
  21. Handle access provisioning, role management, and authentication issues
  22. Own certificate lifecycle management (generation, renewal, deployment)
  23. Validate certificate chains, keystores, and encryption standards

  24. Prevent certificate-related outages through proactive monitoring

  25. Incident Response, Troubleshooting & Reliability

  26. Respond to infrastructure alerts and production incidents
  27. Perform deep troubleshooting across OS, network, storage, and services
  28. Lead root cause analysis and implement preventive measures
  29. Improve monitoring, alerting, and operational runbooks
  30. Act as a senior escalation point during major incidents

Preferred Skills & Experience

  • 10–15+ years of experience in System Administration, Infrastructure Engineering, or SRE roles
  • Proven experience supporting enterprise, production-critical environments
  • Strong background in operations, reliability, and incident management

Core Technical Skills

  • Operating Systems: Deep expertise in Windows Server administration; Strong hands-on experience with Linux (RHEL/CentOS or equivalent)
  • Cloud Infrastructure: Experience administering cloud compute, networking, storage, and IAM; Strong understanding of cloud security and operational best practices
  • Security & Compliance: Experience with vulnerability management and remediation workflows; Understanding of infrastructure hardening and compliance standards
  • Certificates & Identity: SSL/TLS certificate lifecycle management; Enterprise directory services, SSO, and MFA systems
  • Automation & Scripting: Proficiency in PowerShell, Bash, and/or Python for automation
  • Process & Operational Discipline: Strong experience with ITIL-based change management; Comfortable authoring change plans, rollback procedures, and documentation; Experience working with ticketing and workflow tools; Familiarity with monitoring, alerting, and incident tracking systems

Preferred Qualifications

  • Cloud or infrastructure certifications (vendor-agnostic or cloud-specific)
  • Experience with endpoint management or configuration management tools
  • Exposure to container platforms and orchestration (Kubernetes or equivalent)
  • Experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, ARM, etc.)
  • Familiarity with mail systems and relay configurations
summary: Senior System Administrator role focused on enterprise infrastructure stability, security, and collaboration across cloud, Windows/Linux systems, and security protocols.
